article.title: Microscopic description of fission in odd-mass uranium and plutonium nuclei with the Gogny energy density functional

multiple_choice_question.text: Which of the following is NOT a theoretical framework mentioned in the article for studying fission?
choices: Mean-field approximation
Shell model
Hartree-Fock-Bogoliubov (HFB) method
Energy density functional (EDF)

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the main advantage of the Equal Filling Approximation (EFA) in studying fission of odd-mass nuclei?
choices: It completely eliminates the need for time-consuming blocking calculations.
It allows the use of the standard gradient method, simplifying the treatment of multiple constraints.
It accurately reproduces the results of full HFB calculations with blocking.
It accurately predicts the specialization energy for all odd-mass nuclei.

multiple_choice_question.text: In the context of the HFB-EFA method, what does the "average" (AV) solution represent?
choices: The average of multiple HFB-EFA calculations with different blocked configurations.
An HFB calculation for the even-even neighbor nucleus.
An HFB calculation for the odd-mass nucleus, but without any blocking performed.
An average of the experimental data for the fission process.

multiple_choice_question.text: What does the presence of a second minimum in the fission path of Uranium-243 (panel a) indicate?
choices: The nucleus undergoes two sequential fission events.
The nucleus exhibits a shape isomer along the fission path.
The nucleus is unstable in its ground state.
The nucleus prefers to decay via alpha emission.

multiple_choice_question.text: What can be concluded from the comparison of the density contour plots for the 1F and 2F configurations of Uranium-243 at Q20=154 b (panels b and c)?
choices: The 1F configuration is more elongated than the 2F configuration.
The 2F configuration represents a fragmented nucleus.
The 1F configuration has a higher density than the 2F configuration.
The density distributions of 1F and 2F configurations are practically identical.
